description: One person is dead and two others were wounded after authorities in Texas were alerted to a shooting said to have taken place on the Mexican side of the Rio Grande on Wednesday.
title: Texas police alerted to shooting on the Rio Grande
title_page: Texas police alerted to shooting on the Rio Grande | Daily Mail Online
text:
One person is dead and two others were wounded after authorities in Texas were alerted to a shooting said to have taken place on the Rio Grande, the river which straddles the US-Mexico border.
The initial report of a shooting was received by the Starr County Sheriff’s Office at approximately 4pm local time on Wednesday, according to The Monitor.
Investigators said that the shooting took place near the border town of Fronton, Texas.
When authorities reached the scene, they found two injured men and a third person who had died.

The injuries to the two men do not appear to be life-threatening.
The identities of the victims have yet to be released.
The incident is also being investigated by US Border Patrol and the Texas Department of Public Safety troopers.
‘According to the victims, they were shot from the Mexican side while they were fishing on a boat,’ according to authorities.
A US Border Patrol agent scans the US-Mexico border while on a bridge over the Rio Grande on March 13, 2017 in Roma, Texas. The region has in the past seen violent incidents involving Mexican authorities
So far, investigators have refused to divulge more details about the circumstances of the shooting.
The region has in the past seen violent incidents involving Mexican authorities.
In November, a Border Patrol agent and a Texas state trooper were struck by bullets that were fired from the Mexican side of the Rio Grande, according to The Monitor.
Witnesses said that the bullets were fired during a gun battle involving the Mexican military.
The US Drug Enforcement Agency believes that Mexican drug cartels have been active in trafficking narcotics along the US-Mexico border.
Earlier this year, the DEA published a map showing various cartels and their areas of heightened activity along the frontier with the US as well as deep inside the country, according to The Houston Chronicle.
Last month, the Trump administration took its first step to building the wall on the Mexican-American border as it has requested proposals from contractors and plans to have a prototype built by mid-March.
The US Customs and Border Protection issued the preliminary requests and said it will accept proposals for the design of the wall.
The agency also said the it would release requests on or about March 6 asking companies for prototype ideas.
The best designs for the wall will be evaluated and selected by March 20.
The details listed on the federal government's website for business opportunities also said vendors will be asked to provide proposals and the price of the costs for Trump's long-promised wall.
While President Trump has previously mentioned the development will cost $12billion, Republican Speaker of the House Paul Ryan and Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell estimate the project will cost $15 billion.
